sentences.english: In order to make strong shot, a player must be able to hold racket very hard.
sentences.chinese: 为了击球有力，选手必须将拍子抓得非常紧。

sentences.english: He didn't hit out, but hit the wicket by a fluke.
sentences.chinese: 他并未用力击球，却歪打正着击中了三柱门。

sentences.english: Right-handed batters usually hit to left field.
sentences.chinese: 右撇子击球手把球打到左外野。

sentences.english: The home plate umpire calls balls and strikes and runs the game.
sentences.chinese: 司球裁判负责判断坏球与击球和推进比赛的进行。

sentences.english: To improve your tennis strokes you try using a different grip.
sentences.chinese: 为了提高你网球的击球法，你试试用另一种握拍方法。

sentences.english: Tom's hit brought in both base runners.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆的击球使两名跑垒员得了分。

sentences.english: But Hendrawan is excellent at playing overhead stokes and underarm strokes.
sentences.chinese: 叶诚万的头顶击球和臂下击球都是绝好的。

sentences.english: But Hendrawan is excellent at playing overhead stokes and underarm strokes.
sentences.chinese: 叶诚万的头顶击球和臂下击球都是绝好的。

sentences.english: Whenever the batsman chopped at the ball, he hit it.
sentences.chinese: 有多少种方式使击球手退场？

sentences.english: The young man swung his mallet for another blow.
sentences.chinese: 这个年轻人挥动球棍准备击球。

sentences.english: The rookie turned out to be the best hitter on the team.
sentences.chinese: 新手证明是队里最出色的击球员。

sentences.english: Badminton is a unique sport that can incorporate hitting skills from other sports.
sentences.chinese: 羽球是一种结合其他运动击球技巧的独特运动。

sentences.english: An overhead shot hit very hard, usually before the ball has bounced.
sentences.chinese: 过顶大力击球，通常是在球落地反弹之前。

sentences.english: This will help produce a more consistent look and feel for a golf shot.
sentences.chinese: 这样击球前球手可以有更稳定视觉和感觉。

sentences.english: That will help him explode to wherever the next ball goes.
sentences.chinese: 这样将帮助他迅速的跑到下一个击球点。

sentences.english: Tom has beaned as many as three batters in one game.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆在一局里击中3个击球员的头部。

definition: to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
club (golf)/cue (billiards)/also written 球桿|球杆[qiu2 gan1]
to serve the ball/to tee off
ten-pin bowling/bowling ball/(baseball etc) ground ball
